attributes.action: Gyms should stay open for the month of lockdown.
attributes.additional_details: Gyms are essential for mental and physical health and are not a source of Covid-19 transmission. They should therefore remain open during lockdown. It isn’t easy to exercise outside during the winter and there are people who rely on gyms for both physical and mental health.  Obesity and poor health are known COVID-19 risk factors.  Regular exercise helps in the fight against Illness.  Shuttling  gyms during lockdown it contradictory to the advice from medical professionals.
attributes.background: Allow the already Covid secure gyms in England to remain open during the month of lockdown.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Keep gyms and leisure facilities open during any lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556956

Prevent gyms closing due to a spike in Covid 19 cases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333869

The Committee will be holding a debate on Covid-19 restrictions on gyms and sport on Monday 23 November. You will be able to watch the debate on Parliament TV at 4.30pm: https://www.parliamentlive.tv/Commons
